newsitem.title: USA: Cahners Business Confidence Index 67.7 in March.
newsitem.headline: Cahners Business Confidence Index 67.7 in March.

text.p: The Cahners Business Confidence Index (CBCI) rose to 67.7 in March from 67.4 in February, Cahners Economics said.
The CBCI now stands at its highest level since February 1996, Cahners said.
"Although the increase from last month was a scant 0.3 (points), it shows that the business sector remains sanguine about the future of this economic expansion," a Cahners report said.
Five of the seven CBCI components rose between February and March. Measures of inventories and capital spending increased most dramatically, up 3.8 points and 2.1 points respectively.
Indexes of employment, marketing spending and production/sales rose as well.
Research and development fell 2.3 points, and product introductions fell 3.8 points.
"The business sector may be telling us that over the next several months, (businesses) plan to focus on existing products rather than begin new ventures," the report said.
Regionally, business confidence showed the greatest gain in the Midwest, up 2.7 points. Confidence declined most markedly in the West, down 2.4 points.
